Ivern's winrate is like 35% isn't it?

New champions are always unbalanced when they are first released, and they are usually overtuned. Riot will normally begin making balance adjustments on live servers no sooner than 2 weeks after release, unless there are major problems. 

Given how unique Ivern is, compared to pretty much every other champion, the community is somewhat slow to pick up on his strengths and how to play with and against him. As a result, most people will see him as weak, but the few who have got an early grasp on him will seem strong. There isn't really a middle ground at this point. 

Do I think he is 'broken' ... no, not really. He has a lot of strategic advantages that he offers to his team, but he doesn't really have all that much damage. He is designed as a Jungle support. The closest role in relation to this is a Mage Support. Fed Mage Supports are strong on their own, so it is theoretically possible for him to get fed and be strong. However, as a Support, is meant to assist strong carries. All of the things that you have mentioned as his strengths, are his tools for doing just that.
